definition: to send/to mail/to entrust/to depend on/to attach oneself to/to live (in a house)/to lodge/foster (son etc)
to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent

sentences.english: Our purchase confirmation will be sent to you very soon.
sentences.chinese: 我方订货确认书不日将寄达你处。

sentences.english: Postal applications must be received by 12 December.
sentences.chinese: 邮寄的申请书须于12月12日以前寄达。

sentences.english: I really hope this card arrives in time for Valentine's Day.
sentences.chinese: 我切盼这张卡片能在情人节当天准时寄达。

sentences.english: The letter of credit for each order shall reach us 30 days before the date of shipment.
sentences.chinese: 每批货物的信用证应在发货日前30天寄达我方。

sentences.english: The letter mailed last night will reach him tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 昨日寄出那封信，明天将会寄达他手中。

sentences.english: Your L/C must reach us 30 days before delivery.
sentences.chinese: 贵方的信用证一定要在交货前30天寄达我方。

sentences.english: Enclosed is the receipt which we sent to same customer successfully.
sentences.chinese: 附件里的存根，我们之前成功寄达客户。

sentences.english: The letter of credit for each order shall reach us 30 days.
sentences.chinese: 每批货品的名誉证应在发货日前30天寄达我方。

sentences.english: Postal applications must is received by 12 December.
sentences.chinese: 邮寄的申请书须于12月12日以前寄达。

definition: to forward (a message, letter, article etc)
ordinary mail (as opposed to air mail etc)
to reject (visa application etc)/(commerce) to return to sender/item returned to sender
